nodes.name: Fetch Amazon URLs from Google Sheets

parameters.content:
### üîπ **SECTION 1: Trigger & Read Product URLs**

**Nodes Combined:**

* `Start Workflow (Manual Trigger)`
* `Fetch Amazon URLs from Google Sheets`

üìå **What Happens Here:**
When you click **"Execute workflow"**, the automation kicks off. It reads a list of Amazon product URLs from a connected **Google Sheet** ‚Äî each URL representing a product you want to analyze.

üß† **Why This Is Useful:**
You don't have to input product links manually every time. Just **paste your URLs in the Google Sheet**, and this step will automatically fetch them all. Perfect for monitoring dozens (or hundreds) of products.

üìã **Fields Expected in Google Sheet:**

* `URL` (Amazon product link)
* *(Other columns will be auto-filled later)*

üîß **Icons Involved:**

* ‚ö° `Trigger`
* üìÑ `Google Sheets`

---

### ü§ñ **SECTION 2: AI Agent + Scraper + Parser**

**Node: `Amazon Product Analyzer (AI Agent)` + Sub-nodes:**

* `OpenAI Chat Model`
* `MCP Client (Bright Data)`
* `Structured Output Parser`

üìå **What Happens Here:**

1. üîç The **AI Agent** passes each product URL to:

   * üõ∞Ô∏è The **MCP Client**, which uses **Bright Data's Mobile Carrier Proxy** to scrape data safely from Amazon (bypassing detection).
   * üìä The **data collected** includes:

     * Units sold last month
     * Current price
     * Stock availability
     * Review count
     * Average rating
     * Sales rank

2. üí¨ Then, the **OpenAI Chat Model** intelligently evaluates this data and gives a **performance rating out of 10**, simulating a product analyst's decision-making.

3. üì¶ Finally, the **Structured Output Parser** transforms the AI‚Äôs natural language response into **clean JSON fields** that n8n can write back to your Google Sheet.

üß† **Why This Is Useful:**
This section automates **competitive product research**, letting you know which products are worth stocking, promoting, or avoiding ‚Äî without manually checking every listing.

üõ†Ô∏è **Icons Involved:**

* ü§ñ AI Agent
* üß† OpenAI Chat
* üåê MCP Scraper (Bright Data)
* üì§ JSON Parser

---

### üìà **SECTION 3: Update Google Sheet with Final Data**

**Node: `Update Sheet with Product Insights`**

üìå **What Happens Here:**
Once scraping and AI evaluation are done, the workflow **updates the original Google Sheet** with all the new fields:

| Column                  | Description                                        |
| ----------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- |
| `Units Sold`            | Estimated number of units sold in the last 30 days |
| `Current Price`         | Latest listed price on Amazon                      |
| `Stock Availability`    | Whether product is in stock, and how many units    |
| `Review Count & Rating` | Total reviews and average rating                   |
| `Sales Rank`            | Rank in overall and subcategory                    |
| `Performance Rating`    | AI-generated score out of 10 based on all factors  |

## üöÄ Amazon Product Performance Analyzer Workflow

**Automate product research + scoring using AI, scraping, and Google Sheets.**

---

### üîπ **SECTION 1: Trigger & Read Product URLs**

**Nodes Combined:**

* `Start Workflow (Manual Trigger)`
* `Fetch Amazon URLs from Google Sheets`

üìå **What Happens Here:**
When you click **"Execute workflow"**, the automation kicks off. It reads a list of Amazon product URLs from a connected **Google Sheet** ‚Äî each URL representing a product you want to analyze.

üß† **Why This Is Useful:**
You don't have to input product links manually every time. Just **paste your URLs in the Google Sheet**, and this step will automatically fetch them all. Perfect for monitoring dozens (or hundreds) of products.

üìã **Fields Expected in Google Sheet:**

* `URL` (Amazon product link)
* *(Other columns will be auto-filled later)*

üîß **Icons Involved:**

* ‚ö° `Trigger`
* üìÑ `Google Sheets`

---

### ü§ñ **SECTION 2: AI Agent + Scraper + Parser**

**Node: `Amazon Product Analyzer (AI Agent)` + Sub-nodes:**

* `OpenAI Chat Model`
* `MCP Client (Bright Data)`
* `Structured Output Parser`

üìå **What Happens Here:**

1. üîç The **AI Agent** passes each product URL to:

   * üõ∞Ô∏è The **MCP Client**, which uses **Bright Data's Mobile Carrier Proxy** to scrape data safely from Amazon (bypassing detection).
   * üìä The **data collected** includes:

     * Units sold last month
     * Current price
     * Stock availability
     * Review count
     * Average rating
     * Sales rank

2. üí¨ Then, the **OpenAI Chat Model** intelligently evaluates this data and gives a **performance rating out of 10**, simulating a product analyst's decision-making.

3. üì¶ Finally, the **Structured Output Parser** transforms the AI‚Äôs natural language response into **clean JSON fields** that n8n can write back to your Google Sheet.

üß† **Why This Is Useful:**
This section automates **competitive product research**, letting you know which products are worth stocking, promoting, or avoiding ‚Äî without manually checking every listing.

üõ†Ô∏è **Icons Involved:**

* ü§ñ AI Agent
* üß† OpenAI Chat
* üåê MCP Scraper (Bright Data)
* üì§ JSON Parser

---

### üìà **SECTION 3: Update Google Sheet with Final Data**

**Node: `Update Sheet with Product Insights`**

üìå **What Happens Here:**
Once scraping and AI evaluation are done, the workflow **updates the original Google Sheet** with all the new fields:

| Column                  | Description                                        |
| ----------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- |
| `Units Sold`            | Estimated number of units sold in the last 30 days |
| `Current Price`         | Latest listed price on Amazon                      |
| `Stock Availability`    | Whether product is in stock, and how many units    |
| `Review Count & Rating` | Total reviews and average rating                   |
| `Sales Rank`            | Rank in overall and subcategory                    |
| `Performance Rating`    | AI-generated score out of 10 based on all factors  |

üìà **Why This Is Useful:**
Now your spreadsheet becomes a **live product intelligence dashboard**, perfect for:

* üë®‚Äçüíº Product managers deciding what to sell
* üì¶ Suppliers checking demand
* üìä Marketers picking hot products to promote

üõ†Ô∏è **Icon Involved:**

* üìù Google Sheets (Update Node)

---

## üí° Final Outcome:

Your workflow is now a **smart Amazon trend analyzer**, delivering:

* üîÅ Repeated product evaluation at scale
* ‚è±Ô∏è Instant product scoring without manual research
* üìä Clean, structured data ready for decision-making

---
